ACT
76
Separation of household items
The surviving spouse and the decedent's descendants who lived with the decedent in the same household at the time of death, belong to household items that serve to meet their daily needs, such as furniture, household appliances, bed linen and the like, but not if these items are significant value.
Items so separated are not taken into account when calculating the necessary part, nor are they included in the heir's inheritance.
The persons referred to in paragraph 1 of this article shall acquire separated objects in co-ownership, in equal parts.
